definitions.definition: Involving subjective moral evaluations, especially when these evaluations are implicit and unexamined.
One who practices or defends interventionism.
Of or pertaining to interventionism, or an advocate thereof.
The Japanese art of paper folding.
A piece of art made by folding paper.
The materials science technology that applies the art of origami to products.
The materials science that studies origami applications in various material.
The mathematics field that studies folding 2-d surfaces into 3-d structures, using construct folds and creases akin to that from the art of origami.
A layer of earth covered with grass; sod.
A piece of such a layer cut from the soil. May be used as sod to make a lawn, dried for peat, stacked to form earthen structures, etc.
A sod of peat used as fuel.
The territory claimed by a person, gang, etc. as their own.
(with "the") A racetrack; or the sport of racing horses.
To cover with turf; to create a lawn by laying turfs.
(Ultimate Frisbee) To throw a frisbee well short of its intended target, usually causing it to hit the ground within 10 yards of its release.
To fire from a job or dismiss from a task.
definitions.example: Eight managers were turfed after the merger of the two companies.

definitions.definition: To cancel a project or product.
definitions.example: The company turfed the concept car because the prototype performed poorly.

definitions.definition: To expel, eject, or throw out; to turf out.
To transfer or attempt to transfer (a patient or case); to eschew or avoid responsibility for.
To worship.
To love with one's entire heart and soul; regard with deep respect and affection.
definitions.example: It is obvious to everyone that Gerry adores Heather.

definitions.definition: To be very fond of.
To adorn.
Adoration
Showing adoration or admiration.
A pairing of two things, people or teams, especially for a competition
The tropical plant Manihot esculenta, from which cassava and tapioca are prepared.
Cassava root, eaten as a food.
A food starch prepared from the root.
A punishable offense, under international law, for violations of the law of war by any person or persons, military or civilian.
A long, slender, chiefly terrestrial amphibian of the order Caudata, superficially resembling a lizard.
A creature much like a lizard that is resistant to and lives in fire (in which it is often depicted in heraldry), hence the elemental being of fire.
A metal utensil with a flat head which is heated and put over a dish to brown the top.
A small broiler (North America) or grill (Britain) that heats the food from above, used in professional cookery primarily for browning.
definitions.example: The chef first put the steak under the salamander to sear the outside.

definitions.definition: The pouched gopher, Geomys tuza, of the southern United States.
A large poker.
Solidified material in a furnace hearth.
Portable stove used to heat or dry buildings under construction.
To use a salamander (cooking utensil) in a cooking process.
Loss of appetite, especially as a result of disease.
Anorexia nervosa.
A way up a hill in the South Downs.
Any of the prisons set up in Britain for delinquent boys from 1895 to 1983.
Any institution which provides education to young offenders.
A musical piece written typically for a solo voice with orchestral accompaniment in an opera or cantata.
To conquer, defeat.
To reach some destination or object, despite difficulty or toil (now usually intransitive, with preposition or locative adverb).
To triumph or achieve victory in (a game, a war, etc.).
To gain (a prize) by succeeding in competition or contest.
definitions.example: to win the jackpot in a lottery;  to win a bottle of wine in a raffle

definitions.definition: To obtain (someone) by wooing; to make an ally or friend of (frequently with over).
To achieve victory.
definitions.example: Who would win in a fight between an octopus and a dolphin?

definitions.definition: To have power, coercion or control.
definitions.example: Ever since the 2013 Boston Marathon bombing, Bostonians now run as "One Boston." The terrorists did not win.

definitions.definition: To obtain (something desired).
definitions.example: The company hopes to win an order from the government worth over 5 million dollars.

definitions.definition: To cause a victory for someone.
definitions.example: The policy success should win the elections for Mr. Smith.

definitions.definition: To extract (ore, coal, etc.).
The act of obtaining something, as in a contest or by competition.
(chiefly in the plural) The money, etc., gained by success in competition or contest, especially in gambling.
A new opening.
The portion of a coalfield out for working.
That constitutes a win.
definitions.example: the winning entry in the competition

definitions.definition: That leads to success.
definitions.example: a winning formula, strategy, etc.

definitions.definition: Attractive.
definitions.example: a winning smile

definitions.definition: Of a student, to fail a class; to not pass.
definitions.example: He flunked math, again.

definitions.definition: Of a teacher, to deny a student a passing grade.
definitions.example: Unsatisfied with Fred's progress, the teacher flunked him.

definitions.definition: To shirk (a task or duty).
To back out through fear. (Commonly in the phrase 'flunk it', the 'it' referring to a specific task avoided; sometimes without specific reference describing a person's attitude to life in general.)
A mountain summit or crest that lacks forest growth despite a warm climate conducive to such, as is found in many places in the Southern Appalachian Mountains.
To become bald.
Having no hair, fur or feathers.
(by extension) Denuded of any hair- or fur-like covering.
definitions.example: The bald cypress is a tree that loses its leaves in winter.

definitions.definition: Of tyres: whose surface is worn away.
(of a statement or account) Unembellished.
(of a statement) Without evidence or support being provided.
The art of stuffing and mounting the skins of dead animals for exhibition in a lifelike state.
To stuff and mount the skin of a dead animal.
OK
A small, flat, baked good which is either crisp or soft but firm.
A sweet baked good (as in the previous sense) usually having chocolate chips, fruit, nuts etc. baked into it.
A bun.
An HTTP cookie.
A magic cookie.
An attractive young woman.
The female genitalia.
A piece of crack cocaine, larger than a rock, and often in the shape of a cookie.
To send a cookie to (a user, computer, etc.).
Affectionate name for a cook.
A cucoloris.
The act of backtracking
To retrace one's steps.
definitions.example: I dropped my sunglasses and had to backtrack to find them.

definitions.definition: To repeat or review work already done.
definitions.example: If we backtrack through this problem, maybe we can figure out where we went wrong.

definitions.definition: To taxi down an active runway in the opposite direction to that being used for takeoff.
definitions.example: Speedbird One: enter and backtrack Runway 27 Left.

definitions.definition: To exercise a racehorse around the racetrack in the opposite direction to that in which races are run.
The small mass of cells from which a new organism develops; a seed, bud or spore.
A pathogenic microorganism.
The embryo of a seed, especially of a seed used as a cereal or grain. See Wikipedia article on cereal germ.
The origin of an idea or project.
definitions.example: the germ of civil liberty

definitions.definition: An equivalence class that includes a specified function defined in an open neighborhood.
To germinate.
To grow, as if parasitic.
Shyness
Someone thought to have an unusual degree of enlightenment.
To shine light on something.
To decorate something with lights.
To clarify or make something understandable.
To decorate the page of a manuscript book with ornamental designs.
To make spectacular.
To glow; to light up.
To be exposed to light.
To direct a radar beam toward.
Enlightened
A baseball game in which many runs are scored, especially by home runs.
definitions.example: The game turned into a 15-9 slugfest.

definitions.definition: A game or match in which heavy blows are exchanged.
definitions.example: The championship bout was a slugfest; both boxers were bloodied.

definitions.definition: Tough, heated contest
definitions.example: Lakers win slugfest over Clippers

definitions.definition: The planned movement of troops, vehicles etc.; a strategic repositioning; (later also) a large training field-exercise of fighting units.
definitions.example: Joint NATO maneuvers are as much an exercise in diplomacy as in tactics and logistics.

definitions.definition: Any strategic or cunning action; a stratagem.
A movement of the body, or with an implement, instrument etc., especially one performed with skill or dexterity.
A specific medical or surgical movement, often eponymous, done with the doctor's hands or surgical instruments.
A controlled (especially skilful) movement taken while steering a vehicle.
definitions.example: Parallel parking can be a difficult maneuver.

definitions.definition: To move (something, or oneself) carefully, and often with difficulty, into a certain position.
To guide, steer, manage purposefully
To intrigue, manipulate, plot, scheme
definitions.example: The patriarch maneuvered till his offspring occupied countless key posts

definitions.definition: A Japanese wheat noodle
A bird of the species Passer domesticus, native to much of Eurasia, introduced in many other temperate environments.
Of an achievement, exceeding the highest previously recorded level in that activity.
(in the plural) Transports of delight; words or actions performed in a state of ecstasy.
A person in a state of ecstasy.
Feeling or characterized by ecstasy.
Extremely happy.
Relating to, or caused by, ecstasy or excessive emotion.
definitions.example: ecstatic gaze; ecstatic trance

definitions.definition: Sodium bicarbonate (usually baking soda).
Sodium carbonate (usually washing soda).
Sodium in chemical combination.
Carbonated water (water impregnated with pressurised carbon dioxide, originally made with sodium bicarbonate).
(especially in the northeast) Any carbonated (usually sweet) soft drink.
(especially in the northeast) A glass, bottle or can of this drink.
The first card in the dealing box in the game of faro, which is discarded to leave 51 cards in play.
Any of several small vehicles, especially a small motor car for use on short journeys.
A motor car having a single row of seats.
A light, open, American horse-drawn vehicle with four large wheels.
A gadabout or vagabond.
The quality or state of being sober.
Soundness of judgement.
Sleep before midnight, on the belief that early sleep hours conduce to health and beauty.
(sometimes humorous) Extra sleep or a special nap.
A single girl (or, rarely, a boy) who helps a host family with childcare, housework, or both while staying as a guest with a host family and generally receiving a small allowance (or pocket money).
To enforce the law and keep order among (a group).
definitions.example: Extra security was hired to police the crowd at the big game.

definitions.definition: To clean up an area.
To enforce norms or standards upon.
definitions.example: to police a person's identity

definitions.definition: Monitoring or regulation
Patrolling by the police
Maintenance of public order
A mark, such as a line of seaweed, showing the highest level reached by a body of water.
(by extension) The peak or apex of something.
To cause sorrow or distress to.
To feel very sad about; to mourn; to sorrow for.

definitions.definition: To experience grief.
To harm.
To submit or file a grievance (about).
A governor of a town or province.
A manager or steward, e.g. of a farm.
A female oarsman.
Involving or constituting treason
Of or pertaining to or resembling tin.
definitions.example: The object had a tinny appearance.

definitions.definition: Pertaining to the thinness and cheapness of tin or similar-looking metals, in contrast to a heavier, more valuable metal.
definitions.example: The shop was filled with tinny tourist geegaws.

definitions.definition: Pertaining to a thin, unpleasant sound recalling that of tin being rapped.
definitions.example: The piano was not simply out of tune, but had become downright tinny.

definitions.definition: A can of beer.
A small open aluminium boat.
Small package of drugs wrapped in foil.
Someone who wipes.
Something, such as a towel, that is used for wiping.
Something, such as a windscreen wiper, that is designed for wiping.
A movable electric contact in some devices.
A junior role in the engine room of a ship, someone who wipes down machinery and generally keeps it clean.
The hair that grows over the bone ridge above the eye socket.
A dormer, usually of small size, whose roof line over the upright face is typically an arched curve, turning into a reverse curve to meet the horizontal line at either end.
A clump of waste fibres that builds up in a roller machine.
To build up waste fibres in a roller machine.
To signal with one's eyebrows.
A psychopathological condition characterized by delusional fantasies of wealth, power, or omnipotence.
Narcissistic personality disorder.
An obsession with grandiose or extravagant things or actions.
To act as parent, to raise or rear.
The process of raising and educating a child from birth until adulthood.
A doll made from cloth and stuffed with rags.

definitions.definition: A pie or tart made with a filling of cooked apples.
Anything positive that is quintessentially American.
Of a bed, to make an apple-pie bed.
The leader of a work crew.
The member of a jury who presides over it and speaks on its behalf.
(during the era of slavery) A black (slave) assistant to the white overseer who managed field hands.
Relating to the macula, the area of the retina responsible for detailed central vision.
Acting in advance to deal with an expected change or difficulty
definitions.example: We can deal with each problem as it pops up, or we can take a proactive stance and try to prevent future problems.

definitions.definition: An emotional period of doubt and anxiety sometimes experienced by people who realize that their life is already half over.
The ridge over the eyes; the eyebrow.
The first tine of an antler's beam.
The forehead.
The projecting upper edge of a steep place such as a hill.
definitions.example: the brow of a precipice

definitions.definition: A gallery in a coal mine running across the face of the coal.
Aspect; appearance.
The gangway from ship to shore when a ship is lying alongside a quay.
The hinged part of a landing craft or ferry which is lowered to form a landing platform; a ramp.
To bound or limit; to be at, or form, the edge of.
A waterproof long coat made of rubberized cloth.
By extension, any waterproof coat or raincoat.
Waterproof rubberized cloth.
To act as a patron of; to defend, protect, or support.
To make oneself a customer of a business, especially a regular customer.
To assume a tone of unjustified superiority toward; to talk down to, to treat condescendingly.
To blame, to reproach.
Of animals: trained to avoid urinating or defecating in the house, except within a litterbox, toilet, or other receptacle.
The radiation of alpha particles as a result of radioactive decay.
To walk in high heels.
(footwear) Having tall heels.
Wearing high heels.
An internal combustion engine equipped with an electric generator, used to extend the range of battery-powered electric vehicles.
Using or designed for use by both hands at once
Using or designed for use by two people
Ambidextrous
Having two hands
In a two-handed manner.
Anything that protects or defends; defense; shelter; protection.
A shape like that of a shield; usually, an inverted triangle with sides that curve inward to form a pointed bottom, commonly used for police identifications and company logos.
A large expanse of exposed stable Precambrian rock.
A place with a toilet seat: an outhouse; a lavatory.
Parts at the front and back of a vehicle which are meant to absorb the impact of a collision
To protect, to defend.
To protect from the influence of
A person or party that is considered to be neutral and thus suitable to serve as a mediator.
An indirect reference; a hint; a reference to something supposed to be known, but not explicitly mentioned
A confection of honey or sugar and roasted nuts, often with other ingredients.
Something on which tax must be paid.
Subject to taxation.
A serious and often fatal disease caused by the infection of an open wound with the anaerobic bacterium Clostridium tetani, found in soil and the intestines and faeces of animals.
A state of muscle tension caused by sustained contraction arising from a rapid series of nerve impulses which do not allow the muscle to relax.
A component of the circulatory system, such as an artery, capillary, or vein, that carries blood.
An ordinal number such as first, second and third.
definitions.example: The most common numerals in Latin, as in English, are the "cardinals"...and the "ordinals"... — F. M. Wheelock, Wheelock’s Latin, 6th ed. revised (2005), p97

definitions.definition: A book used in the ordination of Anglican ministers, or in certain Roman Catholic services
(of a number) indicating position in a sequence
Of or relating to the groupings called orders
Intercardinal
A long, narrow, pliable strip of leather, cloth, or the like.
A strip of thick leather used in flogging.
Something made of such a strip, or of a part of one, or a combination of two or more for a particular use.
A piece of leather, or strip of wood covered with a suitable material, used to hone the sharpened edge of a razor; a strop.
A narrow strip of anything, as of iron or brass.
The flat part of the corolla in ligulate florets, as those of the white circle in the daisy.
The leaf, exclusive of its sheath, in some grasses.
A gun, normally a personal firearm such as a pistol or machine pistol.
Credit offered to a customer, especially for alcoholic drink.
(with "the") A championship belt, or by extension, the title.
To beat or chastise with a strap; to whip, to lash.
To fasten or bind with a strap.
To sharpen by rubbing on a strap, or strop

definitions.definition: A secondary heading, especially one printed above another.
A memorable slogan attached to a commercial brand.
The chemical element (symbol Ra) with an atomic number of 88. It is a soft, shiny and silvery radioactive alkaline earth metal.
A type of cloth woven from silk or synthetic yarn, often with a shiny appearance.
To treat (a tumour, etc.) with radium.
Bibliographic
A signed check of the type used to draw money from a bank account containing no information as to the amount to be paid with it.
A grant of complete authority to spend an unlimited amount of money, or to take other actions without restraint.
One who is in charge of, or performs the task of creating, collecting, cataloguing, and organising, archives.
definitions.example: The billionaire’s will established a trust to create a staff of archivists that would chronicle and preserve his rise to prominence.

definitions.definition: To restore (someone) to their former state, reputation, possessions, status etc.
To vindicate; to restore the reputation or image of (a person, concept etc.).
To return (something) to its original condition.
To restore or repair (a vehicle, building); to make habitable or usable again.
To restore to (a criminal etc.) the necessary training and education to allow for a successful reintegration into society; to retrain.
To return (someone) to good health after illness, addiction etc.
To go through such a process; to recover.
A rail set alongside a dangerous place in order to improve safety.
Having a bright, light-green colour, like that of a lime.
A factory or other place of work where pay is low and conditions are poor or even illegal.
Any of various breeds of dog originating in Scotland and England as sheepdogs
To smile with one's eyes.
Gaiety; merriment.
A playful antic.
A social gathering.
To make merry; to have fun; to romp; to behave playfully and uninhibitedly.
definitions.example: We saw the lambs frolicking in the meadow.

definitions.definition: To cause to be merry.
Merry, joyous, full of mirth; later especially, frolicsome, sportive, full of playful mischief.
Free; liberal; bountiful; generous.
To convey on a raft.
To make into a raft.
To travel by raft.
To dock (toolbars, etc.) so that they share horizontal or vertical space.
The sport of guiding a raft while descending a river, especially through rapids known as white water rafting.
A strip of fabric worn around the head.
A hair-accessory, made of a flexible material and curved like a horseshoe, for holding one's hair back.
A strip of fabric attached to the top of the spine of a book; used as decoration and reinforcement.
A thin slip of iron on the tympan of a printing-press.
A technical terminology unique to a particular subject.
Language characteristic of a particular group.
Speech or language that is incomprehensible or unintelligible; gibberish.
To utter jargon; to emit confused or unintelligible sounds.
A variety of zircon.
A fake ring or other jewellery sold as genuine.
Astonished, amazed or so suddenly surprised as to be unable to speak.
Agreement or concurrence of opinion, will, or action.
A harmony in sound, pitch and tone; concord.
Agreement or harmony of things in general.
definitions.example: the accord of light and shade in painting

definitions.definition: An agreement between parties in controversy, by which satisfaction for an injury is stipulated, and which, when executed, prevents a lawsuit.
An international agreement.
definitions.example: The Geneva Accord of 1954 ended the French-Indochinese War.

definitions.definition: Assent
Voluntary or spontaneous impulse to act.
definitions.example: Nobody told me to do it. I did it of my own accord.

definitions.definition: To make to agree or correspond; to suit one thing to another; to adjust.
To bring (people) to an agreement; to reconcile, settle, adjust or harmonize.
To agree or correspond; to be in harmony; to be concordant.
To agree in pitch and tone.
To grant as suitable or proper; to concede or award.
To give consent.
To arrive at an agreement.
A Chinese gooseberry vine fruit, having a hairy brown skin and dark green (or in the case of the kiwi fruit gold, yellow) flesh with fine black seeds, almost always varieties of Actinidia deliciosa.
That which destroys something.
A small, fast warship with light armament, smaller than a cruiser, but bigger than a frigate.
